jrigby.openstack_queue.server

Class OSConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrigby.openstack_queue.server.OSConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class OSConnection
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Provides a simplified abstraction to the OpenStack API
    Author:
    jason

      • createServer

        public org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server createServer(String name,
                                                         String imageId,
                                                         org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Flavor flavor,
                                                         String availabilityZone,
                                                         String[] securityGroups,
                                                         org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.KeyPair keyPair,
                                                         int retryCount,
                                                         org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.options.CreateServerOptions... serverOptions)
        Creates a VM instance. The VM created using this instance is not guaranteed to have been created successfully. It is up to the programmer to subsequently check that the VM started correctly.
        Parameters:
        name - Server name
        imageId - image identifier to use for the new VM
        flavor - machine flavour
        availabilityZone - availablity zone in which to create the server
        securityGroups - security groups to apply to the new server
        keyPair - key pair to inject
        retryCount - number of times to attempt to create this server if an error is encountered
        serverOptions - additional server options
        Returns:
        a Server object representing the VM being created
        See Also:
        checkServerStatus(Server)

      • terminateServer
